MONL.content: sea is lacking there [that is, in Paris, which lacks distancing of being-elsewhere, compared to Algeria]
MONL.linkedContent: sea is lacking there [that is, in Paris, which lacks distancing of being-elsewhere, compared to Algeria]

LOBL.content: approaching edge of a text, lose sight of text and its outside, regular submerging of shore
LOBL.linkedContent: approaching edge of a text, lose sight of text and its outside, regular submerging of shore

LOBL.content: pose question of bord, bord de mer, question of borderline preceding the determination of all dividing lines I just mentioned [i.e. the general bord before the contextual one?]
LOBL.linkedContent: pose question of bord, bord de mer, question of borderline preceding the determination of all dividing lines I just mentioned [i.e. the general bord before the contextual one?]

LOBL.content: death sentence, instant as elusive as last grain of sand in hourglass, death as result of dissemination of rhythm of life w/ no coup d’arrêt, unbordered/unbounded arrhythmy on beach that’s continuation of a sea: her pulse “scattered like sand”
LOBL.linkedContent: death sentence, instant as elusive as last grain of sand in hourglass, death as result of dissemination of rhythm of life w/ no coup d’arrêt, unbordered/unbounded arrhythmy on beach that’s continuation of a sea: her pulse “scattered like sand”

POR.content: un ubiquiste, a “ubiquitist,” “professor au large,” back from sea
POR.linkedContent: un ubiquiste, a “ubiquitist,” “professor au large,” back from sea

PAS.content: at the indistinct edge of sea, viens said just once between us, desire to go out to sea

PAS.content: acc. Derrida, all [?] Blanchot’s books concern fascinating ellipsis (l’ellipse fascinante) of what leaves the sea

PAS.content: Derrida’s ideal to drown in true sea of Blanchot’s text, to have loved it as the original first name
